meanings.sent1: The sad news seemed to depress her greatly.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather can sometimes depress people's moods.
meanings.sent3: Why did the math book depress the novel? Because it had too many problems!
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world seemed to depress her spirits.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds seemed to depress the entire atmosphere of the room.

meanings.definition: Reduce the level or strength of something.
meanings.sent1: Overwatering can depress the growth of plants.
meanings.sent2: The medication can depress the activity of the immune system.
meanings.sent3: Why did the deflated balloon depress the party? Because it lost its bounce!
meanings.sent4: The economic downturn continues to depress the stock market.
meanings.sent5: The lack of sunlight can depress the production of vitamin D in the body.

meanings.sent1: Please depress the button to start the machine.
meanings.sent2: The lever is used to depress the brake in emergency situations.
meanings.sent3: Why did the heavy snow depress the roof? Because it caused a collapse!
meanings.sent4: The weight of the books seemed to depress the shelf below.
meanings.sent5: The footprints in the sand depress the soft surface.
